unit.doc: A binding to https://github.com/jedisct1/libsodiumlibsodium which wraps http://nacl.cr.yp.to/NaCl

exception.doc: Raised when attempting to deserialize a malformed key or nonce.

type.doc: Phantom type indicating that the key is public.
Phantom type indicating that the key is secret.
Phantom type indicating that the key is composed of a secret key and a public key. Such a key must be treated as a secret key.

value.doc: Primitive used by this implementation. Currently "curve25519xsalsa20poly1305".
Size of public keys, in bytes.
Size of secret keys, in bytes.
Size of channel keys, in bytes.
Size of nonces, in bytes.
random_keypair () generates a random key pair.
random_nonce () generates a random nonce.
nonce_of_bytes b creates a nonce out of bytes b. If b is not nonce_size byte long, Size_mismatch is raised.
increment_nonce ?step n interprets nonce n as a big-endian number and returns the sum of n and step with wrap-around. The default step is 1.
wipe_key k overwrites k with zeroes.
precompute sk pk precomputes the channel key for the secret key sk and the public key pk, which can be used to speed up processing of any number of messages.
equal_public_keys a b checks a and b for equality in constant time.
equal_secret_keys a b checks a and b for equality in constant time.
equal_channel_keys a b checks a and b for equality in constant time.
compare_public_keys a b compares a and b.
of_public_key k converts k to type storage. The result is public_key_size bytes long.
to_public_key s converts s to a public key. If s is not public_key_size long, Size_mismatch is raised.
of_secret_key k converts k to type storage. The result is secret_key_size bytes long.
to_secret_key s converts s to a secret key. If s is not secret_key_size long, Size_mismatch is raised.
of_channel_key k converts k to type storage. The result is channel_key_size bytes long.
to_channel_key s converts s to a channel key. If s is not channel_key_size long, Size_mismatch is raised.
of_nonce n converts n to type storage. The result is nonce_size bytes long.
to_nonce s converts s to a nonce. If s is not nonce_size long, Size_mismatch is raised.
box sk pk m n encrypts and authenticates a message m using the sender's secret key sk, the receiver's public key pk, and a nonce n.

box_open sk pk c n verifies and decrypts a ciphertext c using the receiver's secret key sk, the sender's public key pk, and a nonce n. If authenticity of message cannot be verified, Verification_failure is raised.
fast_box ck m n encrypts and authenticates a message m using the channel key ck precomputed from sender's secret key and the receiver's public key, and a nonce n.

fast_box_open ck c n verifies and decrypts a ciphertext c using the channel key ck precomputed from receiver's secret key and the sender's public key, and a nonce n. If authenticity of message cannot be verified, Verification_failure is raised.
Primitive used by this implementation. Currently "curve25519".
Size of group elements, in bytes.
Size of integers, in bytes.
equal_group_elt a b checks a and b for equality in constant time.
equal_integer a b checks a and b for equality in constant time.
mult n p multiplies a group element p by an integer n.
base n computes the scalar product of a standard group element and an integer n.
of_group_elt ge converts ge to type storage. The result is group_elt_size bytes long.
to_group_elt s converts s to a group_elt. If s is not group_elt_size long, Invalid_argument is raised.
of_integer i converts i to type storage. The result is integer_size bytes long.
to_integer s converts s to a integer. If s is not integer_size long, Invalid_argument is raised.
Primitive used by this implementation. Currently "ed25519".
Size of public keys, in bytes.
Size of secret keys, in bytes.
random_keypair () generates a random key pair.
wipe_key k overwrites k with zeroes.
equal_public_keys a b checks a and b for equality in constant time.
equal_secret_keys a b checks a and b for equality in constant time.
compare_public_keys a b compares a and b.
of_public_key k converts k to type storage. The result is public_key_size bytes long.
to_public_key s converts s to a public key. If s is not public_key_size long, Size_mismatch is raised.
of_secret_key k converts k to type storage. The result is secret_key_size bytes long.
to_secret_key s converts s to a secret key. If s is not secret_key_size long, Size_mismatch is raised.
sign sk m signs a message m using the signer's secret key sk, and returns the resulting signed message.
sign_open pk sm verifies the signature in sm using the signer's public key pk, and returns the message. If authenticity of message cannot be verified, Verification_failure is raised.
Primitive used by this implementation. Currently "xsalsa20poly1305".
Size of keys, in bytes.
Size of nonces, in bytes.
random_key () generates a random secret key .
random_nonce () generates a random nonce.
nonce_of_bytes b creates a nonce out of bytes b. If b is not nonce_size byte long, Size_mismatch is raised.
increment_nonce ?step n interprets nonce n as a big-endian number and returns the sum of n and step with wrap-around. The default step is 1.
wipe_key k overwrites k with zeroes.
equal_keys a b checks a and b for equality in constant time.
of_key k converts k to type storage. The result is key_size bytes long.
to_key s converts s to a secret key. If s is not key_size long, Size_mismatch is raised.
of_nonce n converts n to type storage. The result is nonce_size bytes long.
to_nonce s converts s to a nonce. If s is not nonce_size long, Size_mismatch is raised.
secret_box k m n encrypts and authenticates a message m using a secret key k and a nonce n, and returns the resulting ciphertext.

secret_box_open k c n verifies and decrypts a ciphertext c using a secret key k and a nonce n, and returns the resulting plaintext m. If authenticity of message cannot be verified, Verification_failure is raised.
Primitive used by this implementation. Currently "xsalsa20".
Size of keys, in bytes.
Size of nonces, in bytes.
random_key () generates a random secret key .
random_nonce () generates a random nonce.
nonce_of_bytes b creates a nonce out of bytes b. If b is not nonce_size byte long, Size_mismatch is raised.
increment_nonce ?step n interprets nonce n as a big-endian number and returns the sum of n and step with wrap-around. The default step is 1.
wipe_key k overwrites k with zeroes.
equal_keys a b checks a and b for equality in constant time.
of_key k converts k to type storage. The result is key_size bytes long.
to_key s converts s to a secret key. If s is not key_size long, Size_mismatch is raised.
of_nonce n converts n to type storage. The result is nonce_size bytes long.
to_nonce s converts s to a nonce. If s is not nonce_size long, Size_mismatch is raised.
stream k len n produces a len-byte stream c as a function of a secret key k and a nonce n.
stream_xor k m n encrypts or decrypts a message m using a secret key k and a nonce n.
Primitive used by this implementation. Currently "hmacsha512256".
Size of keys, in bytes.
Size of authenticators, in bytes.
random_key () generates a random secret key .
wipe_key k overwrites k with zeroes.
equal_keys a b checks a and b for equality in constant time.
of_key k converts k to type storage. The result is key_size bytes long.
to_key s converts s to a secret key. If s is not key_size long, Size_mismatch is raised.
of_auth a converts a to type storage. The result is auth_size bytes long.
to_auth s converts s to an authenticator. If s is not auth_size long, Size_mismatch is raised.
auth k m authenticates a message m using a secret key k, and returns an authenticator a.
verify k a m checks that a is a correct authenticator of a message m under the secret key k. If it is not, Verification_failed is raised.
Primitive used by this implementation. Currently "poly1305".
Primitive used by this implementation. Currently "sha512".
Size of hashes, in bytes.
equal a b checks a and b for equality in constant time.
of_hash h converts h to type storage. The result is size bytes long.
to_hash s converts s to a hash. If s is not size long, Invalid_argument is raised.
digest m computes a hash for message m.
